Sentencas: We present and discuss the results of ab initio DFT plane-wave supercell calculations of the atomic and molecular oxygen adsorption and diffusion on the LaMnO3 (001) surface which serves as a model material for a cathode of solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Adsorption of atomic and molecular oxygen on the LaMnO3(001) surface:: ab initio supercell calculations and thermodynamics

Sentencas: The dissociative adsorption of O-2 molecules from the gas phase is energetically favorable on surface Mn ions even on a defect-free surface.
Titulo: Adsorption of atomic and molecular oxygen on the LaMnO3(001) surface:: ab initio supercell calculations and thermodynamics

Sentencas: The surface migration energy for adsorbed O ions is found to be quite high, 2.0 eV.
Titulo: Adsorption of atomic and molecular oxygen on the LaMnO3(001) surface:: ab initio supercell calculations and thermodynamics

Sentencas: We predict that the adsorbed O atoms could penetrate the electrode first plane when much more mobile surface oxygen vacancies (migration energy of 0.69 eV) approach the O ions strongly bound to the surface Mn ions.
Titulo: Adsorption of atomic and molecular oxygen on the LaMnO3(001) surface:: ab initio supercell calculations and thermodynamics

Sentencas: The formation of the O vacancy near the O atom adsorbed atop surface Mn ion leads to an increase of the O-Mn binding energy by 0.74 eV whereas the drop of this adsorbed O atom into a vacancy possesses no energy barrier.
Titulo: Adsorption of atomic and molecular oxygen on the LaMnO3(001) surface:: ab initio supercell calculations and thermodynamics

Sentencas: Ab initio thermodynamics predicts that at typical SOFC operation temperatures (similar to 1200 K) the MnO2 (001) surface with adsorbed O atoms is the most stable in a very wide range of oxygen gas pressures (above 10(-2) atm).
Titulo: Adsorption of atomic and molecular oxygen on the LaMnO3(001) surface:: ab initio supercell calculations and thermodynamics
